trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_SEQ_00<tab>Koana has the look of a man intent on finding bananas.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_TODO_00<tab>Speak with the cheerful cook.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Koana.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Wuk Evu.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_001<tab>Spiced ibruq wrapped in najool leaves? That sounds like a winning combination to me!
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_005<tab>Let us see if there are najool leaves to be had in town.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_006<tab>Perhaps the cook Urianger mentioned might be persuaded to spare us a few.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_010<tab>An underground oven! This must be the cook Urianger was talking about.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_015<tab>Hmm... The earth here is indeed fashioned into an oven of sorts. Fascinating.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_000_020<tab>Oh, hello again! Did you need something?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_000_021<tab>Najool leaves! For purposes <var 1A 02 /var>other<var 1A 01 /var> than xibruq pibil, naturally...
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_000_022<tab>Unfortunately, I've just used up my last. You'll have to travel to the lower forests for more.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_100_022<tab>Golmajiik Grove is the source of the finest najool leaves you'll find. Wild variants you sometimes see in city markets can't compare.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_023<tab>I see... I had hoped to avoid such a lengthy venture, but if there's no other way to obtain our ingredient, then to the Ja Tiika Heartland we shall go.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_HUNMURRUK_000_024<tab>Allow me to save you the trip.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_HUNMURRUK_000_025<tab>Traveling there requires that you go through the Ty'iinbek Traverse, but it has caved in. Due to the recent storm, I expect.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_026<tab>What? But that means we can't get our najool leaves!

TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_027<tab>...But we <var 1A 02 /var>can<var 1A 01 /var>, can't we? If there were no other way of procuring them, you would have suspended this feat, or else altered its objective.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_HUNMURRUK_000_028<tab>Perhaps...
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_HUNMURRUK_100_028<tab>Anyway, I apologize for the interruption, but having overheard your conversation, I felt compelled to chime in.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_200_028<tab>That's very kind of you. Any last-minute advice you'd be willing to share?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_HUNMURRUK_300_028<tab>Only to undertake the Feat of Repast with an empty stomach. You may find xibruq pibil to be a delicious but daunting dish to finish.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_400_028<tab>Heh! I can't wait!
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_029<tab>Still...if there are no leaves here, and we can't travel for more, how are we supposed to gather all our ingredients?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_030<tab>These feats are meant to deepen our understanding of the peoples and cultures of Tuliyollal.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_031<tab>So perhaps there is something about xibruq pibil that we have yet to learn. Something of significance other than its recipe or ingredients.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_032<tab>Oh, I see... Like who was the first to make it─its history, that sort of thing!
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_000_033<tab>Ahem! If it's Yak T'el's history you're interested in, you should start with the old war.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_034<tab>Between the Xbr'aal and the Mamool Ja, right?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_000_035<tab>These forests have borne witness to centuries of warfare, the evidence of which remains a scar upon the earth.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_000_036<tab>To know the end of that bloodshed is to know xibruq pibil.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_037<tab>Huh? What does steamed ibruq have to do with bloodshed?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_038<tab>Precisely the question we must answer. Vexing though such a detour may seem, I can think of no other way to approach this feat.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_000_039<tab>In that case, you may wish to visit the site of a settlement ruined by the war. The village of Ilyon Asoh─it lies a short distance to the east.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_040<tab>The village of Ilyon Asoh? Understood! Thank you for your help.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_041<tab>Come, let's go and see this place!

TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_XBALAALCOOKS04898_000_050<tab>I was told not to talk about xibruq pibil. The history of our people and the─<cough>─<var 1A 02 /var>important developments therein<var 1A 01 /var> are another matter.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_055<tab>Everyone knows there was a war between the Mamool Ja and Xbr'aal. But I, uh...may have forgotten some of the details.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_060<tab>The village of Ilyon Asoh must be further east.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_061<tab>Let us continue with haste. For all we know, our competitors may be on our heels.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_070<tab>This place feels forgotten by time...
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_075<tab>So this is the village of Ilyon Asoh...or what's left of it.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_076<tab>It was a place of light and life. My great-grandfather called it home, in fact.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_077<tab>Wuk Evu! I didn't know you were in Yak T'el!
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_078<tab>I was picking up lumber from Iq Br'aax when I heard the Third Promise was on her way to this site of deep historical significance.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_079<tab>I immediately saw another opportunity to be of service, and so followed you here.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_080<tab>Wuk Evu is a shipwright who came to our aid during the Feat of Reeds.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_081<tab>A pleasure. You are a member of the Third Promise's retinue, I presume?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_082<tab>For the moment, I suppose I am. My name is Koana. Pleased to make your acquaintance.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_083<tab>Koana! Now that's a good name. A familiar name! Where have I heard...
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_084<tab>Koana!? As in the Second Promise of Tuliyollal!?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_085<tab>To think that I addressed the Dawnservant's own son as some common retainer! Such disrespect cannot be excused. Please, take up your gun and─
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_086<tab>Oh, come on, not this again!
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_087<tab>I take no offense, so please do not dwell on it.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_088<tab>All right, then. I shan't dwell on it.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_089<tab>A-And right on cue... At least he's consistent?

TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_090<tab>I understand you wish to learn about xibruq pibil. While I am forbidden by the Xbr'aax Rax to divulge any information regarding its preparation, I would be happy to share what I know of Yak T'el's history.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_091<tab>We'd appreciate that!
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_092<tab>In its most basic sense, the conflict between the Xbr'aal and Mamool Ja was one of land.

TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_093<tab>The Mamool Ja live in the lower forest, where the thick canopy obscures the sun and the soil is unforgiving to crops. This drove them to covet the upper forest─the home of the Xbr'aal─and they launched a determined campaign to seize it for themselves.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_094<tab>Yet advantage ever favors higher ground, and the Xbr'aal forces held the upper hand against the invaders, rebuffing them time and again.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_095<tab>But as the state of this village would attest, the tide eventually turned. What brought it about?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_096<tab>Something you know all too well: blessed siblings.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_097<tab>You must understand. The Mamool Ja were once a people as much at war with themselves as they were with others.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_098<tab>The Hoobigo, Boonewa, and Doppro each sought to assert dominance over the others, even as they engaged the Xbr'aal in battle.

TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_099<tab>In an effort to strengthen bonds and discourage infighting, Hoobigo and Boonewa leaders arranged a marriage between their children. However, this political measure altered the course of history in ways no one could have ever imagined.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_100<tab>It was long believed that partners of differing clans could not have children together.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_101<tab>But then it happened. A child arrived who shared the blood of Hoobigo and Boonewa both─a two-headed Mamool Ja.

TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_102<tab>Blessed with tremendous physical strength and magical prowess, he grew into a mighty warrior before eventually arising as the first Autarch─ruler of all three clans.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_103<tab>Such qualities would dispose anyone to leadership. Character notwithstanding.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_104<tab>Under the Autarch's rule, the newly united Mamool Ja became a force to be feared, and the war soon came to a head.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_105<tab>I think it best you see the results firsthand. Let us visit another battlefield from that time, and there I shall continue the tale.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_110<tab>What happened here...?
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_115<tab>By the Twelve...
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKEVU_000_120<tab>I hope I have been of sufficient service to the Third Promise.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_KOANA_000_125<tab>I never imagined our father was instrumental to xibruq pibil's invention...
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_130<tab>Papa really did live up to his words. He traveled the land and learned about our people's myriad cultures.
TEXT_KINGMC103_04899_WUKLAMAT_000_131<tab>And we're doing the same now...
